parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> [[Image:Boundingbox.jpg|right|200px]] Returns a raw bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to [[boundingBox]] but gives more precise measurements.<br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.92</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value/></part></template> An alternative syntax was introduced allowing to specify clipping type to be used, which in some cases could make bounding boxes even more precise. The output of both syntaxes was also extended to include bounding sphere diameter, identical to [[sizeOf]] return value.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> [[boundingBoxReal]] object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Array]] - the extreme points of the model in format [[PositionRelative]], as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> clippingType [[boundingBoxReal]] object <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.92</value></part></template> 

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> clippingType: [[Number]] - can be one of:
* 0 - ClipVisual (could significantly reduce the size of bounding boxes on buildings)
* 1 - ClipShadow
* 2 - ClipGeometry
* 3 - ClipGeneral (same type that is used in main syntax)

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - the extreme points of the model in format [[PositionRelative]], as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_bbr = [[boundingBoxReal]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];
_p1 = _bbr [[select]] 0;
_p2 = _bbr [[select]] 1;
_maxWidth = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 0) - (_p1 [[select]] 0));
_maxLength = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 1) - (_p1 [[select]] 1));
_maxHeight = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 2) - (_p1 [[select]] 2));
</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[str]] (0 [[boundingBoxReal]] [[cursorObject]]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[boundingBox]], [[sizeOf]], [[boundingCenter]]
</value></part></template></root>
